title: Evidence for comparing speeds of light

A beam of light passes from glass into an unknown material. A student takes the data shown in the table and claims that the speed of light in the unknown material is less than the speed of light in the glass. Do the data support the student’s claim?

choices.label: Yes, because the angles of refraction are less than the angles of incidence.
Yes, because the angle of refraction decreases as the angle of incidence decreases.
No, because the speed of light in a material is a property of the material and is not dependent on the angles of the light beams.
No, because the index of refraction of the materials cannot be compared to that of air.

content.answer: Yes, because the angles of refraction are less than the angles of incidence.

skill.text: 3.C: Justify or support a claim using evidence from experimental data, physical representations, or physical principles or laws.
